topic.title: Installation Options
topic.shortdesc: Install a zero-configuration development environment for Couchbase Server using Docker, or manually install your own server.

section.title: Using Docker
section.p: Running a Couchbase Docker container provides a pre-configured server running in a virtual environment. Follow these simple steps to get started as fast as possible:

ul.li: Launch Couchbase container from Docker command line: docker run -t --name db -p 8091-8094:8091-8094 -p 11210:11210 couchbase/server:sandbox
Confirm launch, log into the web console: http://localhost:8091 as Administrator/password

section.title: Download and Install Server
section.p: For manual install and to configure Couchbase on Windows, OS X, and Linux systems, follow the Quick Installation and Setup Guide.
